programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: Short 17: Documentary following snowplough teams and RAC patrols in Scotland and the north of England as they work to ensure the roads are clear if winter weather hits

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: An insight into the working life of officers patrolling the nation's roads, using modern technology and old-fashioned methods to bring criminals to justice

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
The team carries out a raid that turns up a stash of drugs, a weapon and a large pile of cash, while Jon Peacock is amazed to encounter a half-naked man covered in blood on the wintry streets of Lincoln, but the real surprise comes when the officer finds out what he has been up to. Suspicious driving leads Jim Woolerton to discover super-strength lager and drugs, and a speeding motorist comes out with a very middle-class excuse after being clocked travelling at 110mph
S07E03

programme.title: Seven Ways from Sundown (1960)
programme.desc: An inexperienced Texas ranger is given a challenging first assignment - to assist a grizzled veteran in bringing an infamous killer to justice. During the search, the young lawman befriends a charismatic stranger, but does not realise his new acquaintance is the criminal he is pursuing. Western based on Clair Huffaker's novel, starring Audie Murphy and Barry Sullivan

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Seven Ways from Sundown (1960)
programme.desc: An inexperienced Texas ranger is given a challenging first assignment - to assist a grizzled veteran in bringing an infamous killer to justice. During the search, the young lawman befriends a charismatic stranger, but does not realise his new acquaintance is the criminal he is pursuing. Western based on Clair Huffaker's novel, starring Audie Murphy and Barry Sullivan

programme.title: North to Alaska (1960)
programme.desc: Gold prospector Sam travels to Seattle to fetch his partner George's fiancee. When he discovers she has married someone else, Sam takes it upon himself to find a suitable replacement. Unfortunately, his attempts to bring the substitute bride and George together do not go to plan, and a conman is trying to get his hands on their gold. Comedy Western, starring John Wayne, Stewart Granger, Capucine and Ernie Kovacs

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: North to Alaska (1960)

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
A truck careers off the A1, smashing through the side barrier and gets tangled up in live electrics. Even worse, there is a gas pipe a couple of feet away
S04E06

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Jamie Theakston follows the work of the North Yorkshire Police as they take on the big city drug gangs invading their patch from Leeds, Liverpool and Manchester. On the outskirts of York, officers pull over a car that has made a 150-mile round trip into North Yorkshire from Leeds, with four suspects taken into custody after cannabis is found in the car
S06E01

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A case of drink-driving leads to a hot pursuit on the city streets and carnage on the country roads, while a routine stop for speeding gives a lone female officer a worrying surprise. As devastating storms batter the UK, the helicopter crew is called out to rescue a woman trapped by deadly rising river water
S07E06

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
A Tactical Pursuit and Containment (TPAC) operation is in full swing as a vehicle linked to drug dealing is on the run and evading police. As the suspects hit heavy traffic, the team is presented with a perfect window to stop them. PC Rich Woodward tracks down two men who were involved in the assault of a police officer and then ran away and chases them on foot through a field
S02E05

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers step in to deal with a rowdy reveller when things get out of hand on New Year's Eve in Lincoln city centre, while Suzie Ranyard catches out a motorist who claims he has been driving with a dodgy number plate for 18 years. Jon Moon arrests a shoplifter more than happy to admit to his crime and a young lad discovers how hard it is to pull the wool over the eyes of Jon Peacock
S07E08

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc:
Officers race to catch burglars red-handed after two men are seen trying to break into a number of houses in Cheltenham, but the suspects have disappeared by the time they get there. An extensive search reveals a suspected stolen moped, and police dog Elmo picks up a strong scent and starts tracking
S02E03

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc:
A specialist taskforce prepares to raid a premises with suspected links to an organised crime gang, and fear they may come under attack as they try and force entry. A woman calls 999 reporting that her son's car has been petrol bombed outside her house
S02E02

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Flash floods tear through Maryland in the US, a couple get stranded in a Himalayan blizzard, and a boat race is besieged by a rare weather phenomenon
S03E08

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Liam and police dog Titan take part in a full-scale manhunt, while Paul takes two drug dealers by surprise, and a man needs to be rescued from the River Wear. In Darlington, Damo finds a man unconscious after a punch-up and a suspicious driver tries to outfox the interceptors
S13E12

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A 999 call leads to a drugs bust for Liam, and Jacko and the firearms unit rush to flush out a suspect after finding a homemade gun. Dog handler Justin sniffs out the truth when a mum and son tell lies over who a crashed a car, and there is a dangerous high-speed pursuit through the streets of Darlington
S13E13

programme.title: Fights, Camera, Action!
programme.desc:
World's Wildest Fights: George Lamb narrates clips of people fighting with random objects, some bizarre brawls and plenty of angry arguments. Footage includes Italy's Battle of the Oranges, an extreme tomato fight in Australia, a massive water fight in South Korea, one of the dirtiest fights between two women in India, and one young man dressed as a superhero who got involved in a street fight while waiting for his bus
S02E10

programme.title: Red Shoe Diaries
programme.desc:
Double Dare: A woman receives flirtatious fax messages from an attractive man working in an adjacent office building. Laura Johnson stars in Zalman King's erotic drama series
S01E02

programme.title: Red Shoe Diaries
programme.desc:
You Have the Right to Remain Silent: A female police officer arrests the object of her affection in a bid to tell him how she feels. Erotic drama, starring David Duchovny and Denise Crosby
S01E03

programme.title: Red Shoe Diaries
programme.desc:
Talk to Me Baby: A beautiful French woman, Elaine, catches Bud in the men's room with the winner of a wet T-shirt competition, and he does everything in his power to try and win her back
S01E04

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S01E03

programme.title: Raid on Rommel (1971)
programme.desc: A British officer is assigned to lead an attack on a German artillery emplacement in Tobruk. However, he finds the only men available to him are prisoners, pacifist medics and the walking wounded, who he must somehow turn into a crack commando unit. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Burton, John Colicos, Clinton Greyn and Danielle De Metz

programme.title: Gunpoint (1966)
programme.desc: A sheriff tries to stop a train robbery, but is shot by his own treacherous deputy. Recovering from his wounds, he assembles a posse to bring the outlaws to justice, acquiring an uneasy ally in a saloon owner in love with a dancehall singer the fugitives have taken hostage. Western, starring Audie Murphy and Joan Stanley

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
When a bin lorry crashes onto its side, company boss Adam is tested to the max. In blizzard conditions, Lee has been landed with a 44-ton headache
S04E07

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
This edition focuses on North Yorkshire Police targeting crossborder criminals, with a fifth of theft and drug dealing committed by crooks from outside the area. Sergeant Paul is on high alert after a stolen car linked to a recent suspected firearms incident is spotted on his patch, while in Scarborough PC Dan is on the hunt for criminals in a 4x4 who have allegedly been stealing vans - and it is not long before he becomes embroiled in an off-road pursuit.
S06E02

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Brian Conville gives a man a dressing-down for dangerous driving on the school run, and Barry Peach's detective skills come to the fore when he apprehends a fugitive who has been using a false identity. Meanwhile, during an initiative to clamp down on rural crime, officers from Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit find themselves pursuing some stolen tractors
S07E09

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Jon Moon and his dog Kanto are hot on the heels of some burglary suspects, while spot-checks by the unit on the A1 turn up a carrier bag full of cash. Jason Baxter rushes to the scene of an accident where the driver was thrown clear of the car, only for another crash to take place - this time involving a line of vehicles
S07E10

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
In North Yorkshire, police are out in force on a bank holiday weekend, and a high-speed pursuit ensues after a driver fails to stop and drives at a police officer. In the Dales, there's a special operation under way to crack down on motorists flouting the law, including motorcyclists riding without tax or insurance, and speeding. A biker takes a tumble down a steep embankment after losing control on a bend, somehow miraculously escaping serious injury. Jamie Theakston presents.
S12E15

programme.title: Red Planet (2000)
programme.desc: Members of a spaceship crew sent to explore the potential of Mars become stranded and are left fending off attacks from a seemingly unstoppable robot and a swarm of parasitic insects. Sci-fi thriller, starring Val Kilmer, Carrie-Anne Moss and Tom Sizemore

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
This edition focuses on officers cracking down on abuse, trafficking and exploitation In York, Sgt Mick leads early morning raids on two men suspected of exploiting and intimidating young teenage girls through the production of explicit images and videos, while Sgt Julian discovers seven illegal immigrants in the back of a lorry at Wetherby services recently arrived from the continent
S06E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
The high-speed police interception unit opens the door of a drug farm and assists with an emergency landing at Durham Tees Valley Airport. Plus, Jimmy Grieves catches a thief in the act and Darren Cawthorne deals with a driver who is causing problems
S09E02

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Damien Stevens draws his stun gun on an aggressive driver, while the hunt for a suspected armed robber turns up a nasty surprise for dog handler Jimmy Grieves. Paul Jackson grapples with a man armed with a machete, and officers get kitted up to raid the home of a suspected cannabis grower
S09E04

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Matt Turner stops a vehicle with links to drug dealing in Macclesfield and a search of the vehicle reveals the driver definitely has something to hide. On the M6, PC Rich Woodward pursues a speeding vehicle and when he finally stops it, the occupants are unable to keep their story straight and questions are raised over the vehicle's insurance. Will Rich be able to uncover the truth?
S02E06

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
Haulier Ian is sent from Stockport to Essex to shift a 58-ton metal compactor, working with scrapyard owner Leo to move the load in poor visibility and slippery conditions. Ian must avoid hazards in the yard that might puncture his tyres as they direct the remote-controlled compactor onto his truck
S02E01

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
The effects of Hurricane Sandy hitting America, cavers in California caught in flash floods, and the hot-air balloon brought down by wild winds in Canada
S03E09

programme.title: WWE: Raw Highlights
programme.desc:
Wrestling action with the superstars of WWE, including Drew McIntyre, AJ Styles, Becky Lynch, Randy Orton and Seth Rollins. Presented by Tom Phillips, Samoa Joe and Byron Saxton
S01E166

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Lee is confronted by a particularly mouthy motorist who does not know when to call it a day, and Liam arrests a man who denies carrying out a shocking attack, despite the CCTV evidence. Tasers are drawn after a van driver causes carnage and a wanted man holes up in a loft and refuses to come quietly, resulting in a shower of loft insulation, pepper spray and abuse
S14E01

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Spike takes the lead against a runaway car thief in one of the most challenging pursuits ever, while Liam investigates a gang of suspected drug dealers from Nottingham. Elsewhere, supposedly straightforward stop for Jacko snowballs into a late-night showdown with an aggressive youngster
S14E02

programme.desc:

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:

The programme also includes film of a getaway in which robbers tried to evade the law by driving at 180mph

programme.desc:

programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dan Brigginshaw tracks down a driver who has given him the slip on the side roads of Spalding, while Suzie Ranyard comes to the rescue of a motorist with a rather large passenger. Jim Woolerton utilises some of the unit's most advanced kit to catch out a disqualified driver and officers are called out when a dead body is spotted in one of Lincolnshire's many waterways
S07E04

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Jon Moon and his dog Kanto are hot on the heels of some burglary suspects, while spot-checks by the unit on the A1 turn up a carrier bag full of cash. Jason Baxter rushes to the scene of an accident where the driver was thrown clear of the car, only for another crash to take place - this time involving a line of vehicles
S07E10

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Damien Stevens draws his stun gun on an aggressive driver, while the hunt for a suspected armed robber turns up a nasty surprise for dog handler Jimmy Grieves. Paul Jackson grapples with a man armed with a machete, and officers get kitted up to raid the home of a suspected cannabis grower
S09E04

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Inspector Anton Sullivan is on the hunt for an escaped prisoner who is believed to be a high risk to the public, with a drone and dog handlers helping in the search. Anton is then called to a serious collision on the M56 involving a motorcyclist and multiple vehicles, while PC Niaz Waddington deals with boy racers who are weaving through traffic and speeding on the motorway
S03E01

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
After a driver refuses to confirm his real name, the officers take advantage of new facial recognition technology to determine who he really is
S03E02

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PCs Matt Turner and Rich Woodward are on the tail of an uninsured vehicle. When they finally catch up to the vehicle and question the suspect, they're surprised to discover the driver has never taken a driving test. On the M6, Inspector Anton Sullivan is responding to a collision between a car and an HGV. As the HGV has stopped on a live lane, Anton is tasked with trying to stop traffic, across six busy lanes, while in an unmarked police vehicle
S03E03

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PCs Matt Turner and Ian Cosgrove head to the scene of a collision in Middlewich, where an 11-year-old child has been hit by a van. As the child is taken to hospital by an air ambulance, Matt and Ian start their investigation to figure out what happened. On the M56, PC Rowan Burt is searching for a driver wanted for unpaid speeding fines. When he finally catches up with the suspect vehicle, he's surprised to find it's a police car
S03E04

programme.title: The Searchers (1956)
programme.desc: An embittered American Civil War veteran sets out to find his niece, who has been abducted by a renegade Comanche tribe. His search takes him many years, and during the long quest his travelling companion starts to wonder if he intends to rescue her or kill her. John Ford's Western, starring John Wayne, Natalie Wood, Jeffrey Hunter and Vera Miles

programme.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber at the BBC
programme.desc: To mark his 75th birthday, the composer takes a nostalgic journey through the BBC archives, looking back on a collection some of his biggest and best-loved songs, with performances by stars like Barbra Streisand, Elaine Paige, Diana Ross, Michael Ball and Michael Crawford. Andrew also shares stories from behind scenes of his most popular works, shedding light on how he knew Madonna would perform Evita years before she did, how the cast of Starlight Express ended up on roller-skates, and how Jason Donovan and his Technicolour Dream Coat had a new generation falling in love with musical theatre

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc:
Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr: The designers each have two days, a painter, a carpenter and £1,000 to transform a 1930s beach chalet to fit their different briefs. Peter is determined to put being in the bottom four behind him with a big and bold design for his family bolthole chalet and Tom supresses his instincts for cosy chic as he takes on a Caribbean-themed shack. Monika steps out of her usual gothic comfort zone to design a home for a group of friends called The Gin Club and Temi takes on a different approach for her eco-chalet. Jack takes his brief for a team building space for A&E staff as an opportunity to give back to the NHS staff that saved his life. Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen joins as a guest judge
S04E05

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc:
The pair make their way through the centre of the island in the final leg of their trip where they try their hands at pasta-making and synchronised swimming before heading to the outskirts of Palermo where Giovanni has lined up an overnight stay with a group of beer-brewing monks. Finally, they head into Palermo where Anton meets Giovanni's parents and unveils a surprise birthday present
S01E03

After being kicked out of their apartment, Costello and Iris try to find housing before nightfall. Selby is back after a stint in prison and keen to connect with the pair. Costello and Selby don't know if they can trust each other, but as their search for a place to stay grows more desperate, they both stop at nothing to keep Iris safe

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died
S12E03

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy
S03E03

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of this evening's Premier League fixtures, featuring Manchester United v Brentford at Old Trafford and West Ham United v Newcastle United at London Stadium. United were looking to avenge a 4-0 defeat at the hands of Brentford in August. West Ham held Newcastle to a draw when the teams met two months ago, but both teams were in need of a win this time around for differing reasons. Plus, action from last night's contests, which were Chelsea v Liverpool, Bournemouth v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leeds United v Nottingham Forest and Leicester City v Aston Villa

Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died
S12E03

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy
S03E03

Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died
S12E03

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy
S03E03

He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died
S12E03

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy
S03E03

Romantic drama based on Nicholas Sparks' novel, with Julianne Hough, Josh Duhamel and Cobie Smulders

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died
S12E03

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy
S03E03

He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc:

Peter is determined to put being in the bottom four behind him with a big and bold design for his family bolthole chalet and Tom supresses his instincts for cosy chic as he takes on a Caribbean-themed shack. Monika steps out of her usual gothic comfort zone to design a home for a group of friends called The Gin Club and Temi takes on a different approach for her eco-chalet. Jack takes his brief for a team building space for A&E staff as an opportunity to give back to the NHS staff that saved his life. Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen joins as a guest judge

Finally, they head into Palermo where Anton meets Giovanni's parents and unveils a surprise birthday present

programme.desc:
Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy
S03E03

programme.desc:
Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died
S12E03

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy
S03E03

Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.desc:

Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.desc: English nobleman Robin of Locksley returns home from fighting in the Crusades, only to discover that his father has been murdered and his lands seized, while the local people are living in fear under the tyrannical rule of the Sheriff of Nottingham. Branded an outlaw for his defiance, Robin and his Moorish travelling companion go into hiding in the forest, where they recruit a group of bandits to fight for justice, protect the downtrodden, and foil the Sheriff's plan to seize the throne while the king is away at war. programme.desc:

Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy
S03E03

Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

Branded an outlaw for his defiance, Robin and his Moorish travelling companion go into hiding in the forest, where they recruit a group of bandits to fight for justice, protect the downtrodden, and foil the Sheriff's plan to seize the throne while the king is away at war. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.desc:

The only problem is that this suspect was locked up by Kelby in the station's police cell. With the arrival of the suspect's hardnosed lawyer, the team is under pressure to get results but with Humphrey distracted, it falls to Esther to take the lead on this investigation and crack the case. Meanwhile, despite her mother's protestations, Martha remains firm, however painful it might be. Detective drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

Plus, wildlife photographer Hamza Yassin witnesses some unique tiger behaviour and Jean Johansson lends the keepers a hand feeding the koalas

Gyles's story takes him from family Easter egg hunts and searching for the secrets of happiness through to the paradox of combining a love of frivolity and light entertainment with a political career. With the arrival of the suspect's hardnosed lawyer, the team is under pressure to get results but with Humphrey distracted, it falls to Esther to take the lead on this investigation and crack the case. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips
programme.desc:

Gyles's story takes him from family Easter egg hunts and searching for the secrets of happiness through to the paradox of combining a love of frivolity and light entertainment with a political career. For once, Gyles is lost for words as he discusses his blessings on an emotional spring walk with the host

The only problem is that this suspect was locked up by Kelby in the station's police cell. With the arrival of the suspect's hardnosed lawyer, the team is under pressure to get results but with Humphrey distracted, it falls to Esther to take the lead on this investigation and crack the case. programme.desc:

Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef
S02E02

They anticipate that their Christian faith, family and community can help them juggle a chaotic home-life now that they're both back to work and the toddlers are getting more and more active

As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

Kate and Ben find out the lengths the keepers go to in order to maintain her in the best condition possible. Plus, wildlife photographer Hamza Yassin witnesses some unique tiger behaviour and Jean Johansson lends the keepers a hand feeding the koalas

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips
programme.desc:

Gyles's story takes him from family Easter egg hunts and searching for the secrets of happiness through to the paradox of combining a love of frivolity and light entertainment with a political career. For once, Gyles is lost for words as he discusses his blessings on an emotional spring walk with the host

With the arrival of the suspect's hardnosed lawyer, the team is under pressure to get results but with Humphrey distracted, it falls to Esther to take the lead on this investigation and crack the case. programme.title: Am BFG (The BFG) (1989)
programme.desc: A friendly giant befriends a lonely little girl and transports her to a strange land. Unfortunately, a number of the other giants there have acquired a taste for eating children. Determined to stop their nefarious habit, the pair set out to charm the Queen of England into putting her armed forces at their disposal. Animated adventure, based on Roald Dahl's classic tale, with the voices of Donald Smith, Catriona Lexy Campbell and Donna Morrison

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)

programme.title: Tide Lines 2020
programme.desc: Music show featuring the band Tide Lines in a specially recorded performance in Glasgow's SWG3. With the absence of any gigs in 2020, Tide Lines took the opportunity to showcase new performances of classic material and some brand new songs in a specially recorded session. This programme features a selection from that performance originally aired in July 2020. Alongside fans' favourites, the band perform a new Gaelic song and also a beautiful collaboration with Tamzene

programme.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber at the BBC
programme.desc: To mark his 75th birthday, the composer takes a nostalgic journey through the BBC archives, looking back on a collection some of his biggest and best-loved songs, with performances by stars like Barbra Streisand, Elaine Paige, Diana Ross, Michael Ball and Michael Crawford. Andrew also shares stories from behind scenes of his most popular works, shedding light on how he knew Madonna would perform Evita years before she did, how the cast of Starlight Express ended up on roller-skates, and how Jason Donovan and his Technicolour Dream Coat had a new generation falling in love with musical theatre

programme.title: Global Questions
programme.desc: At Cop 27, Brazil's President Lula vowed to begin undoing the environmental destruction seen under former President Bolsonaro, as the new government works towards zero deforestation of the Amazon rainforest. He also said he would focus on the Yanomami indigenous crisis and appointed Brazil's first minister for indigenous peoples. Lyse Doucet travels to Rio de Janeiro, where she and her panel take questions from a local audience on what should be done to protect Brazil's natural resources

programme.title: Talking Business
programme.desc: Examining the business stories and economic trends that are re-shaping our world.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Chiang Mai to Lampang: On this leg of his trip in Thailand, Michael Portillo tries his hand at the art of umbrella-making and learns about northern Thai cookery. He explores the walled and moated city of Chiang Mai, former capital of the Lanna Kingdom before it was annexed by the King of Siam. Travelling south to Lampang, he discovers the former centre of the teak wood business and investigates how successive Thai kings preserved their independence from the rival colonial powers of Britain and France
S01E03

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The Boat People: Liz McIvor tells the story of the people who operated the canal boats, carrying fuel and goods around the country. During the Victorian era they gained reputations for criminality, violence and drinking, but was such a reputation deserved? Liz discovers grisly canal crimes, investigates health and welfare on-board working boats, and looks at why canal children were last on the list to be offered safeguards and formal education. She reveals the campaigners who set out to tackle this injustice, including George Smith of Coalville, Leicestershire, and Sister Mary Ward of Stoke Bruerne, Northamptonshire
S01E05

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
A Weekend Away: Judith goes away for the weekend, leaving Lionel and Jean with the house to themselves. Comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E02

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Stranger on a Train: First episode of the classic comedy sequel. Bob travels down to London in his efforts to find a suitable wedding present, where fate sees him reunited with Terry, returning home after a gruelling spell in the Army. Starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam. From 1973
S01E01

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
Victoria and Her Sisters (1837-1901): The historian investigates the changing role of women in the Victorian era, looking at the work of novelist Elizabeth Gaskell, whose fiction highlighted the plight of needy factory workers. Simon also examines the ground-breaking efforts of doctor Elizabeth Garrett Anderson, health campaigner Mary Seacole and political activists Harriet Stuart Mill and Annie Besant
S01E13

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary telling the dramatic story of the devastating fire at the Paris cathedral on April 15, 2019, following the firefighters who faced the responsibility of saving one of the city's most emblematic and much-loved symbols from burning to the ground

programme.title: Restoring the Earth: The Age of Nature
programme.desc:
Understanding: Exploring the connections within and between ecosystems, looking at how planting trees can reverse the impact of deforestation, help native wildlife to thrive and aid in mitigating the effects of climate change. The programme also examines the complexity within every ecosystem and shows how the wrong species in the wrong place can have catastrophic effects
S01E02

programme.title: A Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
Building work moves to the inside of Griff Rhys Jones' house, and things are at last being built up instead of knocked down, but as the deadline approaches, tempers begin to fray
S01E04

programme.title: How to Make
programme.desc:
How to Make: Headphones: Designer Zoe Laughlin sets out to redesign audio headphones, an intimate item that transport the wearer to another place. In search of inspiration she heads to Hull University to discover a new substance that can turn any surface into a speaker - from a wall to a table and even the bone of a skull. Zoe also looks at the device's history, from the stethoscope-style home contraptions of the 19th century and the game-changing 1980s Sony Walkman. But what will she come up with in her own design?
S01E03

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Chiang Mai to Lampang: On this leg of his trip in Thailand, Michael Portillo tries his hand at the art of umbrella-making and learns about northern Thai cookery. He explores the walled and moated city of Chiang Mai, former capital of the Lanna Kingdom before it was annexed by the King of Siam. Travelling south to Lampang, he discovers the former centre of the teak wood business and investigates how successive Thai kings preserved their independence from the rival colonial powers of Britain and France
S01E03

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The Boat People: Liz McIvor tells the story of the people who operated the canal boats, carrying fuel and goods around the country. During the Victorian era they gained reputations for criminality, violence and drinking, but was such a reputation deserved? Liz discovers grisly canal crimes, investigates health and welfare on-board working boats, and looks at why canal children were last on the list to be offered safeguards and formal education. She reveals the campaigners who set out to tackle this injustice, including George Smith of Coalville, Leicestershire, and Sister Mary Ward of Stoke Bruerne, Northamptonshire
S01E05

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
Victoria and Her Sisters (1837-1901): The historian investigates the changing role of women in the Victorian era, looking at the work of novelist Elizabeth Gaskell, whose fiction highlighted the plight of needy factory workers. Simon also examines the ground-breaking efforts of doctor Elizabeth Garrett Anderson, health campaigner Mary Seacole and political activists Harriet Stuart Mill and Annie Besant
S01E13

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ayutthaya to River Kwai: Michael Portillo journeys through Thailand, stopping to help at a hospital for elephants wounded by landmines and visiting ruined temples in the former Siamese capital of Ayutthaya
S01E04

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The Workers: Liz McIvor examines the Manchester Ship Canal, hailed as the greatest engineering feat of the Victorian age. Widely regarded as troublesome outsiders who led a drunken life of ungodly debauchery, the navvies who built it toiled in a time of rising trade unionism, prompting Liz to consider how well they managed to organise themselves in campaigning for the best possible deal
S01E04

programme.title: Wonders of the Great Barrier Reef with Iolo Williams
programme.desc: The naturalist travels with a specialist dive team looking for signs of hope that the Great Barrier Reef can survive the threat of global warming. Invited on the journey by award-winning underwater cinematographer and marine biologist Richard Fitzpatrick, Iolo dives deep beneath the tranquil surface of the coral sea to discover what state this natural wonder is in

programme.title: The Fairytale Castles of King Ludwig II with Dan Cruickshank
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the aesthetic styles associated with Ludwig II of Bavaria, the king who was considered to be handsome and loved by his people. Dan Cruickshank investigates the mock-medievalism of Neuschwanstein castle and the complex design of Herrenchiemsee, to assess how they are key to learning more about the enigmatic ruler

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc:
Shadow in the Sun: The queen meets an interesting suitor, the Duke of Anjou, much to the Puritans' disapproval. Now she must decide whether to follow her head or her heart. Award-winning drama chronicling the reign of Elizabeth I, starring Glenda Jackson, Ronald Hines, Robert Hardy, Stephen Murray and Bernard Horsfall
S01E03

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc:
Horrible Conspiracies: The monarch's position is increasingly threatened by the imprisoned Mary, Queen of Scots and her loyal supporters, leaving Elizabeth to ponder Mary's fate. Starring Glenda Jackson, Vivian Pickles, David Collings and Stephen Murray
S01E04

programme.title: Julius Caesar Revealed
programme.desc: Mary Beard sets out on a quest to uncover the real Julius Caesar, challenging the received popular view of the Roman politician and general. The classicist looks at how he become the autocratic ruler of Rome, the tactics of his military campaigns, his use of spin and PR on his way to the top, and the reasons behind his assassination on the Ides of March in 44 BC. The scholar also examines his surprising legacy right up to the present day, revealing how his influence is still shaping language, politics and people's everyday lives

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ayutthaya to River Kwai: Michael Portillo journeys through Thailand, stopping to help at a hospital for elephants wounded by landmines and visiting ruined temples in the former Siamese capital of Ayutthaya
S01E04

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The Workers: Liz McIvor examines the Manchester Ship Canal, hailed as the greatest engineering feat of the Victorian age. Widely regarded as troublesome outsiders who led a drunken life of ungodly debauchery, the navvies who built it toiled in a time of rising trade unionism, prompting Liz to consider how well they managed to organise themselves in campaigning for the best possible deal
S01E04

programme.title: Wonders of the Great Barrier Reef with Iolo Williams
programme.desc: The naturalist travels with a specialist dive team looking for signs of hope that the Great Barrier Reef can survive the threat of global warming. Invited on the journey by award-winning underwater cinematographer and marine biologist Richard Fitzpatrick, Iolo dives deep beneath the tranquil surface of the coral sea to discover what state this natural wonder is in

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Bangkok: Michael Portillo visits the Thai capital of Bangkok, mid-way through his rail tour of the country, where he learns how the late-19th-century King Rama V built a grand palace and introduced railways to the country. He discovers the fine terminus commissioned by the king and meets a historian and designer, who shares family roots with the present royal dynasty. Michael also learns that King Rama V's love of steam engines was inspired by Queen Victoria
S01E05

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Heritage: Liz McIvor explores the heritage of the canal network. After years of decline, the inland waterways were eventually restored to become places of leisure and tranquillity. Liz visits the Pontcysyllte Aqueduct in north Wales and travels to Birmingham where canals have become catalysts for property development and urban regeneration
S01E06

programme.title: Jet! When Britain Ruled the Skies
programme.desc:
The Shape of Things to Come: Part two of two. The development of the UK's passenger airline industry following the Second World War, which by 1960 was the global leader and boasted routes stretching throughout the Empire. The aircraft used included the British-built Vickers Viscount and de Havilland Comet - the world's first passenger jet airliner, which could fly twice as high and fast as its predecessors. Narrated by Barbara Flynn
S01E02

programme.title: High Society (1956)
programme.desc: Romantic complications arise when a playboy composer sets out to win back his ex-wife. However, she is about to marry another man - and the situation becomes even more difficult when a cynical reporter enters the fray. Musical comedy based on The Philadelphia Story with a score by Cole Porter, starring Bing Crosby, Frank Sinatra and Grace Kelly, with Louis Armstrong appearing as himself

programme.title: The Miracle of the Bells (1948)
programme.desc: Ailing aspiring actress Olga Treskovna dies before the premiere of her first feature film, and her smitten agent Bill Dunnigan agrees to take her body back to her hometown for burial, as per her last request. Olga's other final wish is for her movie to reach cinemas, despite opposition from studio executives, who are reluctant to introduce a new star who can no longer appear in other films. However, Olga hoped her starring role will help inspire the people of her down-at-heel hometown to seize control of their futures, and Bill teams up with local priest Father Paul to ensure Olga's legacy is fulfilled. Drama, starring Fred MacMurray, Alida Valli and Frank Sinatra

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Bangkok: Michael Portillo visits the Thai capital of Bangkok, mid-way through his rail tour of the country, where he learns how the late-19th-century King Rama V built a grand palace and introduced railways to the country. He discovers the fine terminus commissioned by the king and meets a historian and designer, who shares family roots with the present royal dynasty. S01E02

programme.title: Armando's Tale of Charles Dickens
programme.desc: Satirist and lifelong Charles Dickens fan Armando Iannucci, worried that endless adaptations of the novelist's work have led his skills to go unappreciated, sets out to prove why he still matters as a writer in the 21st century. Using David Copperfield as a starting point, he unpicks the language and the revolution of a master storyteller, and with the help of funnymen Barry Cryer, Kevin Eldon and Phill Jupitus, he gets beneath the skin of some of the more outlandish characters. Finally, through encounters with the types of people Dickens wrote about, including lawyers and a debtor, Iannucci claims that his stories are just as relevant today

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 23/06/1994: Simon Mayo presents the chart show from June 23, 1994, featuring Aswad, Dawn Penn, Ace of Base, All-4-One, Shed Seven, the B-52's, Cappella, Elton John and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 30/06/1994: Bruno Brookes presents Juliet Roberts, Let Loose, Reel 2 Real with the Mad Stuntman, the Boomtown Rats, Oasis, Crystal Waters, These Animal Men, the Grid and Wet Wet Wet from June 30, 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 07/04/1983: Simon Bates and Peter Powell present the pop chart programme from April 7, 1983, featuring Dexys Midnight Runners, Culture Club, JoBoxers, Twisted Sister, Michael Jackson, Tracie, FR David, Nick Heyward, Big Country and David Bowie

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 05/04/1990: Anthea Turner hosts the edition first aired on April 5, with performances by artists including Jason Donovan, They Might Be Giants, Happy Mondays, Madonna, Queen Latifah and De La Soul, Emma, UB40, Snap and Alannah Myles

programme.title: When Bob Marley Came to Britain
programme.desc: Documentary examining the reggae superstar's relationship with the UK, and how his universal message of One Love and unity helped inspire a generation of young black British people. The film also takes a revealing look at how Marley spent his time while he was in Britain - the houses he lived in, football kickabouts in Battersea Park, and visits to the UK's growing Rastafarian community, including secret gigs in the north of England

programme.title: Bob Marley Reimagined
programme.desc: A concert at Birmingham's Town Hall celebrating the reggae superstar, featuring songs including Get Up Stand Up, One Love/People Get Ready, Redemption Song, Satisfy My Soul, Is This Love, I Shot the Sheriff and Exodus. Trevor Nelson hosts, while the Chineke! orchestra is joined by Bob's grandson Skip Marley, singer-songwriter JP Cooper and singer Ruby Turner

programme.title: Reggae at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of reggae performances from the BBC archives, featuring footage from programmes including Top of the Pops, Old Grey Whistle Test and Later with Jools Holland. Acts include Bob Marley and the Wailers, Gregory Isaacs, Desmond Dekker, Burning Spear, Althea and Donna, Dennis Brown and Buju Banton

programme.title: Michael Palin: The Art of Travel
programme.desc: Michael takes an imaginary train journey to Blackpool via the LMS posters of the 1920s and 1930s. From 1989

programme.title: Michael Palin's Hemingway Adventure
programme.desc:
The final leg of the commemorative journey begins in Cuba, where Hemingway lived for more than 20 years, and follows Palin's attempts to indulge in some of the author's favourite passions, including drinking, marlin fishing and writing
S01E04

programme.title: Michael Palin: Travels of a Lifetime
programme.desc:
Michael reflects on his fourth travel series, exploring the Sahara. This journey brought him into contact with nomads, refugees and artists who had sought out this vast desert, but also those displaced by war, the migrant crisis and the rise of militant Islam. The journey took Michael over the Atlas Mountains, to a Smara refugee camp, to the famed city of Timbuktu, and into the deep desert as part of a camel train
S01E04

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
When a middle-aged couple are found brutally murdered outside their home, criminal profiler Louise Bergstein and Chief Detective Frederik Havgaard take on the case. He is convinced he knows who the killer is, but Louise's eveidence point to a different person. Sequel to Danish crime dramas Darkness: Those Who Kill, and Blinded: Those Who Kill. Starring Natalie Madueño and Simon Sears. In Danish
S01E01

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Louise locates Bjorn's sister Maria, and it is suggested that the criminal profiler should mentor the young woman, who faces the prospect of having her child taken away from her. Frederik visits the municipality of Breioablik, where Bjorn lived with his family. In Danish
S01E02

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc:
After finally standing up to Jill and throwing her out, Cath decides she and Don are going to join a religious community, and an unexpected guest makes a surprise appearance at Terry's funeral. Comedy, starring Julia Davis, Angus Deayton and Rebecca Front
S01E05

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc:
Jill moves in with Glenn after discovering he is wealthy and seems determined to make a fresh start - until her past finally catches up with her. Black comedy, starring Julia Davis, Mark Gatiss and Angus Deayton
S01E06

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
A Weekend Away: Judith goes away for the weekend, leaving Lionel and Jean with the house to themselves. Comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E02

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Stranger on a Train: First episode of the classic comedy sequel. Bob travels down to London in his efforts to find a suitable wedding present, where fate sees him reunited with Terry, returning home after a gruelling spell in the Army. Starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam. From 1973
S01E01

programme.title: Paris Police 1900
programme.desc:
Guérin is protected by the butchers of La Villette, and waits for the trap to close in on Lépine and his men so that he and his allies can take power. In French
S01E07

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hastings/Rye: The competition comes from in and around Hastings and Rye in East Sussex, where the first host is 52-year-old nursery owner Louise, who plans a fun-filled evening of Thai food. Her guests are horse-mad Emily, who's 40, 56-year-old Caribbean takeaway owner Clive, 23-year-old beauty therapist Chiara and mature student and self-confessed foodie Gary. A power cut threatens to scupper Louise's night before it's even started, until her husband - and farmer - Roddy and his generator come to the rescue. Will the night impress the guests, and particularly the self-appointed Thai food expert at the table?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hastings/Rye: The second night from Hastings and Rye in East Sussex sees host Emily plan an evening of comfort food, including carrot and parsnip soup, meat loaf and apple and blackberry crumble

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hastings/Rye: Australian mature student Gary hosts the third dinner party from Hastings and Rye, East Sussex, planning an evening filled with fun, flash and fabulous flavour

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hastings/Rye: Dec, a former member of 1960s band the Bachelors, hosts the next dinner party from Hastings and Rye, planning to impress his guests with musical surprises and a simple seaside menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hastings/Rye: On the final night in Hastings and Rye, East Sussex, beauty therapist Chiara returns to her roots to throw an Italian dinner party. However, Irish crooner Dec gets on his host's wrong side when he questions her interest in healing crystals and likens her to a page three glamour girl

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Tenerife: Retirement is fast approaching for Chris Wood and Eleanor Clements, who are looking for a holiday home on the coast of north Tenerife where they can spend the winter months. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties, including some stunning cliff-top apartments, within their £120,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Cyprus: John and Della Baines' daughter Megan has already moved to Cyprus. After visiting her and seeing the island for themselves, John and Della have decided it was the perfect spot for a holiday home. For their budget of £45,000, Jasmine Harman shows them five value apartments in and around the west coast resort of Paphos

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
In Portugal, a couple attempt to run a yoga retreat. In France, two Londoners plan to open a gîte. A couple try to renovate a run-down house in Spain into a luxury holiday let

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Essex 1/5: Trucker Tony Houston holds the first dinner party in Clacton-on-Sea, Essex, hoping his menu of scallops on black pudding with pea puree, and sea bass with prawn mash will impress his fellow diners. However, if his food fails to live up to his expectations, he anticipates the whole ambience and presentation of the evening will secure him the £1,000 cash prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Essex 2/5: Anthony Street hosts the second day in Essex, and has his work cut out trying to impress the diners after displaying some unusual table manners the previous night. However, he hopes his passion for quirky entertainment will be enough to win them over

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Essex 3/5: Driving instructor Claire Kelly hosts the third dinner party in Essex. Her devil-may-care approach does nothing to dampen her confidence, and she is convinced hers will be the winning night. Even if her chaotic cooking style and haphazard evening fail to win over the guests, the mother-of-two has some special entertainment lined up to gain a few extra points

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Essex 4/5: Entrepreneur and foraging fan Richard Harris hosts the fourth night of the competition in the Clacton-on-Sea area of Essex. Not everybody is impressed when they discover he has had help, and Claire Kelly accuses him of being a food snob. However, he hopes a performance by the local church choir will help improve the atmosphere

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Essex 5/5: Teacher Kerrie Brinkley-Whittington hosts the final dinner party in Essex, and uses a few props to help her night go with a swing. However, she is soon under fire from entrepreneur Richard, who is not amused to be asked to contribute more to group conversations, and when trucker Tony makes an emergency run to the garden, it looks as if the rhubarb dessert could be just as controversial. At the end of the evening, the winner is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022 Algarve: Danni Menzies helps semi-retired builder Martyn and prison manager Sharon find their dream holiday home on Portugal's Algarve, on a budget of £160,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2019: South-east Cyprus: Retired pair Dawn and Les from Basingstoke, Hampshire, want to relocate to sunny south-east Cyprus, where they're looking for a townhouse or bungalow that all four generations of their family can enjoy. The couple used to be leaders in the Scouts and the Brownies, so Jonnie Irwin has to work hard to earn his house hunting badge, as he comes up with five properties for their £100,000 budget

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
Actor David Morrissey, comedian Lucy Beaumont, diver and Olympic medallist Tom Daley and radio presenter and cancer survivor Adele Roberts take on three challenges set by judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith. They must attempt a savoury quiche Signature, a Technical teatime biscuit and a showstopping day off in cake form
S06E03

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc:
Jamie Oliver shares recipes for homemade gnocchi in a cheesy bacon and pea sauce, aromatic vegetable noodle broth, and a giant Yorkshire pudding stuffed with roasted vegetables and crispy balls of stuffing. Plus, Chetna Makan shares a budget-busting recipe for yoghurt chicken curry, that can be made in a large batch for on-hand meals whenever you need them
S01E05

programme.title: Gemini Man (2019)
programme.desc: An aging assassin is targeted by a mysterious young operative that seems able to anticipate his every move. Discovering that he's being hunted by a younger clone of himself, Henry needs to find out why he's being targeted and who the creator is. Action drama, starring Will Smith, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and Clive Owen

programme.title: Bridge of Spies (2015)
programme.desc: A lawyer in 1950s New York is hired to represent a Soviet spy in a showcase trial designed to demonstrate the fairness of the US justice system. In the face of public condemnation, he argues against the death penalty, a stance that years later leads to his involvement in an exchange of prisoners in East Germany. Steven Spielberg's fact-based Cold War drama, starring Tom Hanks and an Oscar-winning Mark Rylance

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc:
Nikesh and Nicola risk an appearance on live TV in the Lake District while Ed and James go undercover in Greater Manchester. Everyone else is laying low in places from north Wales to Surrey and Brighton, but how long can they go out of sight of the hunters? All in aid of Stand Up to Cancer
S05E02

programme.title: Tempting Fortune
programme.desc:
Some of the trekkers are becoming more and more swayed towards alienating the rest of the group and splurging some of the prize money on home comforts. Can they resist sugary sweetness and an evening in a living room that reminds them of everything back home?
S01E03

programme.title: Tempting Fortune
programme.desc:
The trekkers are now past the halfway point of their arduous journey, and fatigue is setting in. The chance to cut loose and enjoy themselves with a party in the woods and a silent disco may prove hard to resist
S01E04

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: South London 1/5: Divorce lawyer Michelle Camacho hosts the first dinner party in south London, where she hopes that her 1970s menu of duck a l'orange and coleslaw, vegetables and a Bloody Mary sorbet for dessert will help to secure her the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: South London 2/5: Pub manager and artist Matt Wren hosts the second evening in south London, but his dinner party is beset by disasters in the kitchen and arguing guests at the dinner table when Michelle and Licia have a spat. However, one of the five takes a liking to another of the contestants

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: South London 3/5: Licia Snow hosts the third party in south London, and hopes to impress her guests with rustic and homely touches during her laid-back evening. However, her relaxed and calm approach could be threatened when she clashes with Michelle at the dinner table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: South London 4/5: Raphael Steele hosts the fourth night in south London and hopes that his first-ever dinner party will be a success. He plans a Caribbean evening based on old family recipes featuring ackee, saltfish and curried goat, and organises steel drum music for entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: South London 5/5: Swedish businesswoman Charlotte Sundberg hosts the final party in south London. Her tactics are to present a night full of schnapps, folk songs and classic cuisine from her Scandinavian homeland, which she hopes will help her scoop the cash prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Gran Canaria: Ever since Terry Windle and Julia Lenart got together 15 years ago, they have dreamed of having their own place in sunnier climes - and have decided Gran Canaria is the perfect place for them. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their £100,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Aruba: Dentist Michelle Naik and retired entrepreneur Marshal Sutherland from Sheffield have fallen in love with the Caribbean island of Aruba. The couple have now decided it's the perfect place to find an island retreat. With a budget of £130,000 and the help of Scarlette Douglas, they hope to find a holiday home that could one day become a permanent retirement location

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
